data.question: What is the publication year of the article discussing the hydrothermal synthesis of a dense metal-organic layered framework?
Which method was used to synthesize the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound?
What is the role of Cu(CH3CO2)2·H2O in the synthesis of Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2)?
data.answer: Cu(CH3CO2)2·H2O is a precursor used in the synthesis process.

data.question: What was the yield percentage of the crystalline material based on Cu(CH3CO2)2 in the synthesis of Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2)?
How does the coordination geometry of Cu(1) in Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) differ from that of Cu(2)?
data.answer: Cu(1) has a pseudo trigonal pyramid coordination sphere, while Cu(2) has a trigonal planar coordination.

data.question: What evidence supports the presence of only Cu(I) in the synthesized Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) crystals?
data.answer: EPR measurements on single crystals confirmed the presence of only Cu(I).

data.question: What is the significance of the Cu−Cu distance in the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) structure?
data.answer: The Cu−Cu distance being slightly shorter than bond lengths observed for Cu metal indicates a unique bonding environment in the structure.

data.question: How does the synthesis method contribute to the unique properties of Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2)?
data.answer: The hydrothermal synthesis method allows for the formation of unusual oxidation states and coordination spheres, contributing to the compound's unique properties.

data.question: Why is the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound considered extraordinary?
data.answer: It is considered extraordinary due to its multiple unique crystallographic Cu(I) trigonal planar centers and the ability to form under mild conditions.

data.question: What role does the classical (Cu−O) bonding play in the structure of Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2)?
data.answer: The classical (Cu−O) bonding constrains the fumarate anions to be rigidly incorporated into the lattice, preventing the insertion of oxygen or water molecules into the copper−olefin bond.

data.question: Is the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound air-stable due to its dense packing layers?
Does the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound contain waters of hydration?
Is the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound synthesized at a temperature above 200 °C?
Are all copper centers in the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) structure bonded to an olefinic group?
Is the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound expected to be microporous based on its synthesis conditions?
Does the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) compound exhibit a melting point above 300 °C?
Is the elongation of the C=C bond in the Cu2(O2CCH=CHCO2) structure typical for ethylene bonded to low-valent, electron-rich transition metals?
